Articles.Content:
Hello, I have noticed that I am seeing no trees or rocks in my game. I made a copy of my back up so that I can perform a test on a fresh and clean copy. I started a sandbox game, built a simple plane flew west and north of the KSC. I flew quite far away, spent some time flying very close to the ground, landed and saved and reloaded. All this time, I have not seen a single tree. I had ground scatters on, scatter density at 100%, and ground textures at high.

What can be the problem? Can you suggest any debugging steps?

Sorry, I don't have an answer to your question, but I have exactly the same problem. I have a base on the Mun, and like you, I have ground scatters on, scatter density at 100%, and ground textures at high.

I thought it must be because I have about 40 mods installed, but I googled the same question you asked and ended up here first.

I will post the answer here if I find it.

Edited August 16, 2017 by Kurley_Kerbal
Forgot to click "Notify me of replies". Now I can't!

Just in case you have Kopernicus installed, v1.3.0-4's ground scatter is broken. I had to revert to 1.3.0-2 to replace ground scatter.

Otherwise, if this is full stock, I do know ground scatter sometimes doesn't load until a scene change. Even switching to and from a distant craft would suffice.

Edited August 16, 2017 by Gordon Fecyk

Ground scatter only comes into effect after the game is restarted. ie Ground scatter is not turned on by default - say after a new installation or settings reset - Enabling scatter will not make trees and rocks appear instantly. Restart KSP and it should work.
